HDF5

Data Processing

List and analyze HDF5 files for hierarchical data structures. Provides efficient access to large scientific datasets stored in HDF5 format.

1.0.0 Version
3 Actions
Jan 15 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Global Installation

uv pip install scientific-mcps

Individual MCP Installation

uv pip install "scientific-mcps[hdf5]"

Direct Server

uv run mcp_hdf5

Claude Desktop Configuration

{ "mcpServers": { "hdf5": { "command": "uv", "args": ["run", "mcp_hdf5"] } } }

Available Actions

  • list_files
    List HDF5 files in a directory
    Parameters: directory_path, recursive
  • get_structure
    Get the hierarchical structure of an HDF5 file
    Parameters: file_path, max_depth
  • read_dataset
    Read specific datasets from HDF5 files
    Parameters: file_path, dataset_path, slice_range

Usage Examples

HDF5 File Analysis

// List HDF5 files list_files("./data/", recursive: true) // Get file structure get_structure("experiment_data.h5", max_depth: 3) // Read specific dataset read_dataset( file_path: "experiment_data.h5", dataset_path: "/results/temperature", slice_range: "[0:100, :]" )

Data Processing Pipeline

// Explore HDF5 structure get_structure("simulation_output.h5") // Read datasets temperature_data = read_dataset("simulation_output.h5", "/fields/temperature") pressure_data = read_dataset("simulation_output.h5", "/fields/pressure") // Process with pandas load_csv(temperature_data) describe(dataframe)
